newsitem.title: JAPAN: U.S., Japan firms to adopt PDA standard -- paper.
newsitem.headline: U.S., Japan firms to adopt PDA standard -- paper.

text.p: Toshiba Corp said on Monday it would make an announcement later in the morning on an agreement with U.S. firms to standardise specifications for personal digital assistants (PDAs).

A Toshiba spokesman declined to give further details, but a weekend report in the Nihon Keizai Shimbun said major electric machinery makers in the U.S. and Japan, including Toshiba and International Business Machines Corp, have agreed to standardise the specifications by September.
PDAs based on the new standard, with e-mail and database search functions, are expected to go on sale before the end of this year, the paper said.
It said the other firms involved in the agreement are Mitsubishi Electric Corp, Hitachi Ltd, Fujitsu Ltd and Sun Microsystems Inc.
The new format will be based on network computer standards developed jointly by IBM, Sun Microsystems and Oracle Corp last year.
About 50 other electric equipment manufacturers worldwide already plan to adopt the new standards, the paper said.
